text: Thomas Shi-Tao Huang (, June 26, 1936 - April 25, 2020) was a Chinese-born American electrical engineer and computer scientist. He was a researcher and professor emeritus at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC). Huang was one of the important scientist in computer vision, pattern recognition and human computer interaction. Huang was born June 26, 1936, in Shanghai, Republic of China. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Engineers from Illinois Category:American computer scientists Category:Scientists from Illinois
title: Thomas Huang
